esp:page.p: Proto-cuneiform script was invented in the second half of the third millennium BCE and used until the early part of the second millennium BCE, approximately 3500-2900 BCE, generally known as the Archaic Period. This period was extensively described and discussed, with special reference to texts and writing, by the late Robert K. Englund in his magisterial book-within-a-book "Texts from the Late Uruk Period", pages 1-233 in J. Bauer, R.K. Englund and M. Krebernik, Mesopotamien: Spaturuk-Zeit und Frhudynastische Zeit (Orbis Biblicus et Orientalis 160/1). Gottingen, 1998, available as an open access download at https://www.zora.uzh.ch/id/eprint/151545/. The following sketch is based on Englund's discussion to which the reader is referred for a detailed account.
